clinical_scenario: Hemorrhagic Shock. There might be other plausible scenario where patient would present with similar indicators
description: Progressive hypotension with compensatory tachycardia due to blood loss.
expected_interpretation: Progressive hypotension with compensatory tachycardia due to blood loss.

description: Severely elevated blood pressure with sympathetic surge.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Sympathetic activation elevates HR and BP

expected_interpretation: Severely elevated blood pressure with sympathetic surge.

description: Acute coronary occlusion causing pain, tachycardia, mild hypotension.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Pain and reduced output raise HR as BP falls slightly

expected_interpretation: Acute coronary occlusion causing pain, tachycardia, mild hypotension.

description: Irregularly irregular tachyarrhythmia with variable rate.
expected_interpretation: Irregularly irregular tachyarrhythmia with variable rate.

description: Pathologically slow heart rate with possible hypotension.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Cardiac output tracks rate in bradycardia

expected_interpretation: Pathologically slow heart rate with possible hypotension.

description: Rising pericardial pressure causing hypotension and tachycardia.
expected_interpretation: Rising pericardial pressure causing hypotension and tachycardia.

description: Fluid overload causing tachycardia and hypoxemia.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Dyspnea increases both RR and HR

expected_interpretation: Fluid overload causing tachycardia and hypoxemia.

description: Gas exchange failure with low SpO₂ and tachypnea.
expected_interpretation: Gas exchange failure with low SpO₂ and tachypnea.

description: Ventilatory failure with high CO₂ and depressed consciousness.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Hypercapnia depresses consciousness at high levels

expected_interpretation: Ventilatory failure with high CO₂ and depressed consciousness.

description: Airflow obstruction causing tachypnea and hypoxemia.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Bronchospasm leads to tachypnea and hypoxemia

expected_interpretation: Airflow obstruction causing tachypnea and hypoxemia.

description: Hypercapnic/hypoxic episode with increased RR, low SpO₂.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Gas exchange impairment increases CO₂ and decreases SpO₂

expected_interpretation: Hypercapnic/hypoxic episode with increased RR, low SpO₂.

description: Acute V/Q mismatch causing tachycardia and hypoxemia.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Hypoxemia from V/Q mismatch elevates HR

expected_interpretation: Acute V/Q mismatch causing tachycardia and hypoxemia.

description: Infectious process with fever, tachycardia, tachypnea.
expected_interpretation: Infectious process with fever, tachycardia, tachypnea.

description: Severe hypoxemia with stiff lungs and high RR.
expected_interpretation: Severe hypoxemia with stiff lungs and high RR.

description: Controlled sedation with decreased RR and HR.
expected_interpretation: Controlled sedation with decreased RR and HR.

description: Improving hypoxemia after oxygen initiation.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Improved oxygenation allows RR to normalize

expected_interpretation: Improving hypoxemia after oxygen initiation.

description: Metabolic acidosis with hyperglycemia, tachypnea (Kussmaul).

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Acidosis severity tracks with Kussmaul breathing

expected_interpretation: Metabolic acidosis with hyperglycemia, tachypnea (Kussmaul).

description: Severe thyrotoxicosis with fever, tachycardia and hypertension.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Hypermetabolic state raises HR with fever

expected_interpretation: Severe thyrotoxicosis with fever, tachycardia and hypertension.

description: Severe hypothyroid state with bradycardia and hypothermia.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Hypothermia with bradycardia in severe hypothyroidism

expected_interpretation: Severe hypothyroid state with bradycardia and hypothermia.

description: Adrenal insufficiency with hypotension and tachycardia.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Hypotension from cortisol deficiency triggers tachycardia

expected_interpretation: Adrenal insufficiency with hypotension and tachycardia.

description: Hyper cortisol state with hypertension and mild tachycardia.
expected_interpretation: Hyper cortisol state with hypertension and mild tachycardia.

description: High potassium with bradycardia and conduction issues.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Conduction impairment slows HR and may reduce BP

expected_interpretation: High potassium with bradycardia and conduction issues.

description: Low core temperature with bradycardia and hypoventilation.
expected_interpretation: Low core temperature with bradycardia and hypoventilation.

description: Extreme hyperthermia with tachycardia and CNS dysfunction.
expected_interpretation: Extreme hyperthermia with tachycardia and CNS dysfunction.

description: Active convulsion with tachycardia and hypertension.
expected_interpretation: Active convulsion with tachycardia and hypertension.

description: Cerebral ischemia with elevated BP and fluctuating consciousness.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Stress response elevates BP and HR

expected_interpretation: Cerebral ischemia with elevated BP and fluctuating consciousness.

description: Acute bleed with high BP and declining consciousness.
expected_interpretation: Acute bleed with high BP and declining consciousness.

description: Raised ICP pattern; Cushing response possible.
expected_interpretation: Raised ICP pattern; Cushing response possible.

description: Infection of meninges with fever and tachycardia.
expected_interpretation: Infection of meninges with fever and tachycardia.

description: Autonomic symptoms with mild BP/HR rise and pain.
expected_interpretation: Autonomic symptoms with mild BP/HR rise and pain.

description: Recovery after seizure; gradual normalization of vitals.
expected_interpretation: Recovery after seizure; gradual normalization of vitals.

description: CNS depression with low RR, low SpO₂ and bradycardia.
expected_interpretation: CNS depression with low RR, low SpO₂ and bradycardia.

description: Severe hypoventilation with hypoxia and miosis (not tracked).
expected_interpretation: Severe hypoventilation with hypoxia and miosis (not tracked).

description: Autonomic hyperactivity with HR and BP elevation.
expected_interpretation: Autonomic hyperactivity with HR and BP elevation.

description: Stabilization of vitals after surgery.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Recovery from anesthesia normalizes RR and HR

expected_interpretation: Stabilization of vitals after surgery.

description: Physiologic tachycardia with increased BP and RR, then recovery.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Exercise increases RR and HR in parallel

expected_interpretation: Physiologic tachycardia with increased BP and RR, then recovery.

description: Stable parameters within normal limits.
expected_interpretation: Stable parameters within normal limits.

description: Sympathetic surge with HR, BP, RR increase.

key_relationships.clinical_significance: Sympathetic arousal increases HR and BP

expected_interpretation: Sympathetic surge with HR, BP, RR increase.

description: Volume depletion with mild hypotension and tachycardia.
expected_interpretation: Volume depletion with mild hypotension and tachycardia.

description: Fever, tachycardia and possible hypotension during transfusion.
expected_interpretation: Fever, tachycardia and possible hypotension during transfusion.
